meanings.sent1: After playing outside all day, the kids were pooped and ready for bed.
meanings.sent2: She felt pooped after running a marathon.
meanings.sent3: The puppy looked pooped after chasing its tail for hours.
meanings.sent4: The old car sputtered to a stop, pooped out from the long journey.
meanings.sent5: The students were pooped after studying for their exams all night.

meanings.sent1: The dog pooped in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: Please clean up after your dog if it pooped on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally stepped in dog poop after it pooped on the grass.
meanings.sent4: The bird pooped on the car windshield as it flew by.
meanings.sent5: The baby pooped right after eating.

meanings.definition: To break down or fail, as in a machine or system
meanings.sent1: The old computer pooped and wouldn't turn on anymore.
meanings.sent2: The engine pooped out in the middle of the highway.
meanings.sent3: The blender pooped while trying to crush ice.
meanings.sent4: The plan pooped when the main speaker didn't show up.
meanings.sent5: The flashlight pooped just when we needed it most.
